com.esri.mo2.client.aims
Class StoredQueryExtension

java.lang.Object
  |

        +--com.esri.mo2.map.ext.BaseStoredQueryExtension
              |
              +--com.esri.mo2.client.aims.StoredQueryExtension
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, LayerExtension, StoredQueryExtension
public final class StoredQueryExtension
extends BaseStoredQueryExtension

This is the implementation of StoredQueries for a Layer that originates from the ArcIMS server.
A stored query is a query having a parameterized where clause, that is, the where clause has zero or more "placeholders" for user-specified runtime data. By using stored queries, an end user does not need to know about where clause syntax. StoredQueryExtension provides a way to define parameterized queries, as well as a way to construct a QueryFilter for a given set of parameter values (that may have been obtained from a user interface).

Example of useage:

      StoredQueryExtension extension =
            (StoredQueryExtension)aFeatureLayer.getExtension(LayerExtension.STOREDQUERY);

      Cursor cursor = extension.query(queryFilter);
